article: With the introduction of family planning policies in the 1970s, most Chinese teenagers have no brothers or sisters.They get to be the beloved  _  child.But they may not realize that they will have to "  pay back  "the love as their  _  ones grow old.They will have to  care for  lots of old people--their parents, grandparents, their  wife's or husband's  parents and grandparents.China is being  an aging  country. According to the United Nations, an aging society refers to one  _  10 percent or more of the population is over 60, or 7 percent or more is over 65. According to  a report  from the Ministry of Civil Affairs, by 2008, Chinese over 60 years old made up 12 percent of the nation's total population. The  _  for those aged 65 or older was 8.3 percent. In China, people have a belief that "parents raise children; then the children care for the parents as they get old".But this  _  is under stress as the market ey puts millions of young Chinese on the road  in search of  better paying jobs.They are leaving their parents  _  .Now many families are looking more to the government than to their  _  for support when they're old.China has increased its basic social security plan which is  a program  protecting those  in need  , including the old, the disabled and others.These programs are now broad,  _  they are still not highly developed. As more people grow  _  , China will have fewer working people,  _  will slow down economic growth. According to a November 26 report in the Economic Information Daily, an expert said China should  _  its people to have more than one child in the future  though  China should keep its labor population and total population size stable .
